headline: J.P.'s Big Daddy Biscuits
description: This homemade fluffy biscuit recipe is easy to make with simple ingredients that help create giant biscuits. Perfect with gravy or butter and jam.

video.description: See the trick to making huge fluffy biscuits.
video.name: JP's Big Daddy Biscuits

name: J.P.'s Big Daddy Biscuits

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
Whisk together flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt in a large bowl. Cut in shortening until the mixture resembles a coarse meal.
Gradually stir in milk until dough pulls away from the side of the bowl.

Turn out onto a floured surface, and knead 15 to 20 times. Pat or roll dough out to 1 inch thick. Cut biscuits with a large cutter or juice glass dipped in flour. Repeat until all dough is used. Brush off the excess flour, and place biscuits onto an ungreased baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until the edges begin to brown, 13 to 15 minutes.

review.reviewBody: thank you so much. best biscuits i ever had in my 74 years. wife agrees. after first batch took your advice and replaced baking powder. also let the bread machine do the kneading for me.

This is my go-to biscuit recipe. I don't ever knead it as I like fluffier biscuits. Just mix up and pat out on a floured board or drop by spoonfuls onto baking sheet. I also like to use a pastry brush and brush on butter when I bring them out of the oven. People who have dense biscuits should check their expiration date on their baking powder. Even if your can has been opened a long time and hasn't expired yet, it will deteriorate and not work as well.

I followed the instructions as posted, I thought they turned out great. Since I am a butter fanatic, I brushed the tops with melted butter as soon as they started to turn brown on top and then again when they came out of the oven. I have struggled to make biscuits until now.
The best biscuits. My go to recipe!
made great biscuits first timer here and didn't have shortening so used butter worked well if you cut them 1 inch thick they are monsters.
great recipe! used butter instead of shortening and added an egg wash and they turned out great!
Glad I found this recipe again. This makes great big, fluffy biscuits.

I've made these several times. My first round at trying this recipe they came out flat and acrid. I found out that baking powder EXPIRES and causes baked goods to be foul. Make sure all your ingredients listed in this recipe are fresh and room temperature. I've made my own adjustments, substituting with buttermilk and less sugar to taste.
Awesome!!!!
Thank you John Pickett you made me a superstar

I had fun making these easy and yummy biscuits. I have a weird collection of taste buds due to recent Covid, but my husband said they were delicious. Texture was fluffy and HUGE. Almost funny. I used a wine glass to cut them out. I didn't think it was going to make very many, so I doubled the recipe. It made 17 giant biscuits. If you are inexperienced at rolling bread dough, do not be afraid of adding flour to the outside. It will make it much easier to roll without sticking. This is a new go-to for me. Thank you.
I used grands frozen biscuits and a package of peppered gravy mix subbing milk for the water. Perfect and easy.
Quick Easy Delicious

I followed the recipe as written except no sugar. I followed ralloyd suggestions. My biscuits didn't rise much and did not look appetizing. They tasted good though. Don't know where I went wrong. I used Crisco butter shortening and 1/2 cup of canned milk and 1/2 c water. Did not over mix and just patted, not rolled the dough and used sharp biscuit cutter. Did not twist the cutter. So, again don't know where I went wrong?? Maybe next time I'll use self-rising flour.
This is my go to biscuit recipe! I have been using it for years now. Perfect every time.
I don't really wanna do the Stars...I don't know where I went wrong.... I was so proud of myself...then I saw this... Hard little circular things....

These are great! I have a household full of dairy allergies, so I made some changes! I used about 3/4 cup of full fat oat milk. It was a little too much milk, so I had to let it rest. I patted it out on a floured surface with a little extra flour. I used a cookie cutter and pulled the excess off instead of twisting the cutter. I increased the temperature to 450 like someone recommended, but I ended up having to increase the bake time to about 25 minutes. They were a bit dense, but that is probably because I didn't spoon the flour before measuring it. Because of this I ended up with a little more flour than I was supposed to. They ended up pretty good and still rose

I like this recipe. The ingredients and instructions were very easy to follow and understand. I have made biscuits before, but not like these. They were very light and fluffy and tasted good. Thank you for sharing this recipe. -- jyoung
I've made these dozens of times just as the recipe is stated. They always come out well!
Perfect everytime. I use butter instead of shortening and it still works. Add spices like garlic powder and parsley or shredded cheese. Yummy!!
Always turn out great. The only biscuits recipe I use..

This us my #1 go to receipe, this batch was white cheese Big "ehem" mama biscuits...😜. Cant see cheese but it's there. Soooooo soft. crumbly, fluffy and deliciuos! Adding the cheese didnt change the recipe. This is a never fail recipe as long as you DONT OVER KNEED. less is best I dont go over 10 kneeds myself. Yummy many thanks! Update: Not much updates still my go to still a great recipe
made it just like the recipe.
I have tried many recipes and these are the best biscuits I have ever had! Very easy to make, and I followed the recipe as is, except I placed them on a baking stone touching each other.
They come out very fluffy , I used one cup flour and one cup of bisquick. Next I will like to used just the bisquick only to see how they will turn out.
Love these biscuits. Homestyle and perfect. Easy to double recipe and I sometimes use butter for a buttery flavor.
This recipe turned out great. It was way easier to understand and allowed me to make my first successful batch of biscuits. Thanks J.P !!
These biscuits are so easy and so delicious! I did swap ice cold butter for the shortening.

I used I cup each organic Einkorn 100% whole grain flour and organic Einkorn all purpose flour. Didn't rise as much as I hoped but still came out quite yummy. Used oat flour for dusting the board where I kneaded the mix (wanted to add in some oat bran). Am going to go to 3 cups flour plus add a bit of cracked Einkorn next time out.
They came out perfect. Just follow the recipe
My go-to all-time- favorite biscuit recipe!
I always have to triple the ingredients. They work very well for dumplings too.
Delicious and easy!
Instead of using milk I used buttermilk and added 1 tsp baking soda. turned out Great!
An empty tuna can with some holes poked in the bottom makes an excellent biscuit cutter. Perfect size for breakfast sandwich biscuits.
I’m by no means a baker but these turn out perfect every time I make them , mile high and light and fluffy

I am 44 this year and I have NEVER been able to make biscuits. I don't know what it is about today made me try again but I found this recipe and tried it OMG!! I am in love!!!! PERFECTION!! One tip is I don't have the thing to cut the Crisco in so I used the rubber mixers and beat on low until it was like described as a meal, worked wonderfully and I mixed in the milk in 1/2cup increments. I kneaded the dough like 8-10 times and used a juice cup to cut the biscuits!! Thank you so much for sharing this and the tip to not over mix or knead!! Made my SUNDAY
Huge, light, fluffy biscuits. Stop here, no need for other recipes!
Wow this recipe is awesome! It's first time to try making biscuits from scratch and I love this already. My family is happy with this biscuits.

This is my go to recipe and only recipe for biscuits. Don’t over mix the dough and they’ll come out fluffy. I always make the dough the night before and let it chill overnight after cutting them. Add more sugar, if you want more of a scone. Add blueberries and baste with cream. If you want a flaky version mix the ingredients, then roll out dough. Take some chilled butter and grate over dough. Then fold dough like a bed sheet. Lol. And continue until you have layers. Chill dough every fold for at least 30 minutes. and then bake. Comes out amazing too. You can come up with different variations with this dough.
The only recipe I have used for years!!
Worked out well for me! Soured my milk using juice of 1/2 lemon. Also used frozen butter and grated into flour with cheese grater. Do not overmix!
Very easy and absolutely delicious recipe. I make these a few times a month for sure. My family loves them. I even make them ahead and freeze them for larger functions

Loved these! I have been thwarted by many biscuit recipes but this one worked. I prefer butter so I used that rather than shortening. I also did not have whole regular milk but had buttermilk so I used that, and they came out delicious and fluffy. The sugar does not sweeten the biscuit but heightens the flavor. Thank you for the great recipe!
Excellent recipe I just add between 1/2 to 1/4 cup more flour for my preference due to not liking sticky dough early in the morning. lol.

I’ve made these wonderful biscuits too many times to count-they alway turn out beautifully and a mile high. My 10 yr old granddaughter is learning how to make them now and says she can’t wait to be “ in charge of making those biscuits!”
Really easy to make and very good
This recipe works great whether you use butter or shortening. The key is using warm milk. Warm milk activates the baking powder and it also works to let the dough sit covered and rise a bit.
So good!
I make these regularly for biscuits and gravy or breakfast sandwiches. I sometimes brush honey over top before baking. Thank you for sharing this recipe.

Mi pueblo es de una tradición de bisquit, esto por la gran cantidad de restaurantes de comida china (una tradición). Esta receta es de lo mejor, no hay que cambiarle nada, ni agregarle mas. Feliz de hacer mis propios bisquit y disfrutarlos con un café latte.

I loved it! I always sub cold cubed butter in biscuit recipes but I accidentally used a whole stick instead of 1/3 cup. Even so they rose beautifully, were flaky and tender. I definitely recommend this recipe.

Easy, delicious, fluffy... I could go in forever about these biscuits. You have to double the recipe to truly have enough, they disappear fast!! I’ve never used shortening in them, I’ve always made them with butter and they come out AMAZING!!! I love this recipe ????
Great biscuit. Came out perfect.

Since I found this recipe I’ve made them at least a half dozen times. As is this recipe is fantastic! Recently I found an article on how to add fluffiness to a biscuit. Just add an egg to the milk. So I did. They turned out beautifully. My husband likes them even more.
I cut the recipe in half, since it was just me. I used my half and half flour (half whole wheat, half ap). I also added extra sugar. Great recipe!!

This is an amazing biscuit recipe! I make them vegan, using almond milk and they come out just as delicious! I also make them sweet (cinnamon scones), by reducing the salt to 1/2 teaspoon, and adding 1/3 cup dark brown sugar, as well as a tablespoon of cinnamon. I also sprinkled cinnamon sugar on the top, and added a cinnamon glaze on the top. I'm telling you they came out SUPER fluffy and moist with an amazing cinnamon flavour!!!

Just made these tonight for the first time and let me tell you they were amazing!
I used a gluten free flour and they disappeared almost instantly !!! 
One of the first recipes I have found that works exactly as the recipes says.

Please add more recipes!!
I followed the recipe exactly and the biscuits are flat. Didn't rise at all. I will try again.
Look, these are the only biscuits I bother to make. Absolutely love this recipe. It always worth letting them rise overnight in the fridge.

This is a simple and easy recipe to follow...and, they’re delicious! I substitute buttermilk for the milk and it works just as well! The only thing I have had to adjust is the baking time. And, really, the time depends on how dark you want the top of the biscuits to be.
Fluffiest biscuits I've ever made!
Instead of vegetable shorting I use butter. Was a lot better
Followed the recipe exactly and ended up with a tasteless soupy mess. Avoid this recipe until corrected.
This is a great recipe. Kneed and fold well and you'll have restaurant quality biscuits
I used buttermilk as the milk and the biscuits turned out amazing! (Disregard biscuit in left upper corner, it wasn't pretty but still tastes good!)
Very good! Soft with a little crunch on top and bottom. Thanks for sharing!
Switched to buttermilk and they turned out great
This was a very heavy biscuit.

I forgot to knead the dough, but they turned out delicious. They remind me of the biscuits at KFC. I replaced almost 1/2 cup of the flour with cake flour because I've read that's a way to get similar results to the soft wheat that's grown for flour in the South.
Absolutely the best biscuits!
Very good, easy to make, we added grated cheddar cheese. Yummy....

Basics deserve a 4-star receipt! I love all the variations - that earns 5-stars. My input - there is some technique needed. If you want flaky - let it rise - keep the dough cold and fold to get layers. that's how you get it more flakey.
Even though - without a lot of kneading, mine were a bit dense - but no-one objected. very tasty. I'm keeping this recipe in my arsenal! BTW - beer? Ok i'll try it, but soda water may work as well - just saying.
Excellent recipe and easy to make. Really great with gravy too.
Easy to make. Great taste. I did add some chopped up cooked bacon. Turned out great
I made these and totally added too much shortening. I read the tips and did it with butter and it was fantastic!!!!!
These are the best biscuits I have ever made. I double the recipe and they do not last the day in our home.

I just made these and they were perfect! I just added about a tablespoon more shortening than the recipe called for, and used King Arthur flour. Perfect, flaky, fluffy, and not dense at all. I did brush them with butter and pop them in the broiler for 15 seconds at the end just for the perfect color!
It was was really good all I did was double it we love lots of biscuits
11.18.20 There’s a reason why these biscuits are rated 5 stars after more than 4,400 ratings…they’re simply delish! Hands down, the best biscuits I’ve ever eaten.
I don't see myself using any other biscuit recipe. You can do so many things with this! About to make savory dinner biscuits with canadian bacon, cheese, and pickled habanero. Yum!

Made it with butter and about 3/4 plus 2 T of milk. Mixed very little as others said and baked hotter, maybe 425 for about 11 min or so. Also make sure you have enough space between the to get that nice outer crust.
Best biscuits I've ever made.
Best biscuits I've ever made
Very tasty and easy to make!
To much baking powder I’d cut it down

My go to recipe for years now, have never had them turn out anything but delicious! Depending how I'm serving them, I'll use small to large cutter sizes, and they work beautifully every time. In my oven, 17 min bake time gets them the color I want.
Made these again today....perfect every time....quick and easy, and so good!

They are a bit bland for my taste and didn't rise. 

Maybe I kneaded too much.

These were a simple biscuit to make and didn’t take nearly as long to prep as the recipe said. I did use butter instead of vegetable shortening simply because that’s what I had. They were yummy and my family all loved them.
I made it as written. Turned out great.
Delicious!

I love the recipe. It was super easy to follow, but my biscuits were flat and not big, or fluffy. It says to knead it. My Mamaw never really kneaded her biscuits. I think next time I make them I wil only knead them a few times. I used a green bean can that I washed out just for these. It made perfect little biscuits. I got 16 biscuits by using it. I also did a butter wash on the top. I loved the taste. It reminded me of watching my Mamaw make breakfast every morning. Now my house smells delicious. Thank you!!

These are very very good. My one issue is that the biscuits don’t come out quite as light as I’d like, but I imagine this is a technique problem on my part. I’ve also doubled the sugar to make shortcakes and served with strawberries and cream.

Great recipe. I used butter as I avoid shortening. Kneaded them 1/2 as much to keep them tender. I roll out a long rectangle and cut biscuits in squares so I don't have waste. Brushed the biscuits with butter before baking. They turned out so good that I next made a double recipe to freeze so we can have homemade biscuits quickly.
Other reviewers are right... This calls for way too much milk. Start with 1/3 cup, and add a little more, if needed.
My family loves these biscuits!
Good

Really good and very easy! I only used a teaspoon of sugar instead of a tablespoon because it seemed like too much for my taste. And I really love that it makes six big biscuits, it's the perfect amount for a family dinner, thank you!
